channel.title: PnP PowerShell on Microsoft 365 Community Blog
channel.description: Recent content in PnP PowerShell on Microsoft 365 Community Blog

item.title: PnP PowerShell v1.10
item.description: PnP PowerShell is a cross-platform PowerShell Module providing over 600 cmdlets that work with Microsoft 365 environments and more specifically SharePoint Online, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Planner and Power Automate.

item.title: How to use oh-my-posh with PnPPowerShell
item.description: What is oh my posh? Oh-my-posh is an amazing prompt engine that does not only pretty up the terminal you use, but it will ease your work.

item.title: PnP PowerShell to manage list designs and create lists/libraries using list designs
item.description: PnP PowerShell has a set of cmdlets to manage custom list templates.

item.title: Course registration with List formatting
item.description: Recently Tetsuya and Michel shared some great examples of a new option in List formatting, the setValue action within List formatting.

item.title: Getting Started with Azure Shell and PnP PowerShell with Certificates
item.description: I recently encountered a scenario recently where I was looking to do a quick technical check on some advice I was giving to another member of the community regarding PowerShell – especially capturing the output of PnP PowerShell commands and store in a text file.

item.title: How to to get all site collections with their sub webs using PnP PowerShell?
item.description: Sometimes we have a business requirement to get site collections with all the sub-webs so we can achieve the solution easily using PnP PowerShell.

item.title: How to get any site collection users with their roles using PnP PowerShell?
item.description: Introduction Sometimes we have a requirement to get reports of users and their roles on the SharePoint site and we have to export to CSV/Excel format.

item.title: Copy a list - with list items - to another site
item.description: The Problem Have you ever heard this from a client or colleague?

item.title: Fetch User Profile Properties From Site Collection And Export To CSV Using PNP PowerShell
item.description: Introduction Many times we have a requirement like to get users or user profile properties from any SharePoint site collection and we need it in CSV or Excel format.
